isis.stitle: TSI 91-02-03 - Wear Limits For King Pin Bushing Wear (Side Play) and Spindle Vertical End Play

subjectgroup.subject: Wear Limits For King Pin Bushing Wear (Side Play) and Spindle Vertical End Play

geninfo.para: The following procedure may be used to determine when front axle king pin bushing service is required.

svcsubproc.title: KING PIN BUSHING WEAR CHECK

note.para: King pins and bushings must NOT have been recently lubricated before making this check. Measurements must be made PRIOR to lubrication.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 1for the following steps.

step1.para: Raise and support axle on TWO jack stands. If the axle is supported only on one jack stand, a false reading will be obtained.
Apply brakes to eliminate wheel bearing play and to assure getting a correct reading. Failure to do so will result in a false reading.

Mark the tire at 17.5 inch (444.5mm) radius from the center of the spindle. Position a dial indicator at the 17.5 inch (444.5mm) mark to measure tire movement. ACCURATE RESULTS DEPEND UPON MEASUREMENT AT SPECIFIED RADIUS.
Push the wheel inward at the top and measure the movement obtained at the 17.5 inch (444.5mm) radius mark on the dial indicator.

svcsubproc.para: If more than 1/8 inch (3.175mm) movement is observed at the 17.5 inch (444.5mm) mark, king pin bushings should be replaced.

figure.caption: Figure 1. King Pin Bushing Wear Check

svcsubproc.title: SPINDLE VERTICAL END PLAY CHECK
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 2for the following steps.

step1.para: Lift the wheel and tire (spindle only if the tire is removed) so that all clearance is taken up between steering knuckle lower king pin bushing boss, thrust bearing and lower face of I-beam king pin boss.
Use a feeler gauge and measure the clearance between the under side of the knuckle top king pin bushing boss and the top of the I-beam king pin boss (or shims).

svcsubproc.para: If more than 0.060 inch (1.524mm) clearance is observed, add shims as needed to obtain recommended end play of 0.005 to 0.015 inch (0.1270 to .3810mm). Refer to Service Manual STEERING KNUCKLE INSTALLATION for more service information.
